title: Tokyo Summer 2026
description: A 4-day adventure through Tokyo — from Shibuya's neon-lit streets to the serene temples of Asakusa, with plenty of ramen and hidden gems along the way.

activities.title: Arrive at Narita Airport (NRT)
activities.description: Flight lands at 14:00. Pick up Suica card and pocket WiFi at the airport.
activities.tips: Get a 72-hour Tokyo Metro pass at the airport — saves a lot on subway rides.

activities.title: Narita Express to Shibuya
activities.description: Take the N'EX directly to Shibuya Station. About 75 minutes.

activities.title: Check in at Hotel
activities.description: sequence MIYASHITA PARK — a stylish hotel right above Miyashita Park with great city views.

activities.title: Shibuya Crossing & Hachiko
activities.description: Walk to the world's busiest pedestrian crossing. Take photos from the Shibuya Sky observation deck or the Starbucks across the street.
activities.tips: The Mag's Park rooftop has one of the best free views of the crossing.

activities.title: Ichiran Ramen Shibuya
activities.description: Solo-booth ramen experience. Customize your noodle firmness, broth richness, and spice level on the order sheet.
activities.tips: Order extra chashu and the "kaedama" (extra noodles) — you'll want it.

activities.title: Explore Nonbei Yokocho
activities.description: Tiny alley of micro-bars near Shibuya Station. Pick any spot that looks interesting — they're all good.
activities.tips: Most bars seat 6-8 people. Cover charge is usually ¥500-1000.

activities.title: Breakfast at Bills Omotesando
activities.description: Famous ricotta pancakes. Get there early to avoid the queue.

activities.title: Meiji Jingu Shrine
activities.description: Walk through the towering torii gate and forested path to one of Tokyo's most important Shinto shrines.
activities.tips: Write a wish on an ema (wooden plaque) and hang it at the shrine.

activities.title: Takeshita Street & Harajuku
activities.description: Tokyo's kawaii capital. Crepes, vintage shops, and wild street fashion. Don't miss the side alleys.

activities.title: Afuri Ramen (Yuzu Shio)
activities.description: Light, citrusy yuzu shio ramen — a refreshing change from heavy tonkotsu.

activities.title: Omotesando Architecture Walk
activities.description: Walk down Omotesando — Tokyo's Champs-Élysées. Every building is designed by a famous architect: Tadao Ando (Omotesando Hills), SANAA, Herzog & de Meuron.

activities.title: teamLab Borderless (Azabudai Hills)
activities.description: Immersive digital art museum. Book tickets in advance — it sells out fast.
activities.address: Azabudai Hills Garden Plaza B B1F
activities.tips: Wear white clothes — the projections look amazing on them.

activities.title: Omoide Yokocho (Memory Lane)
activities.description: Atmospheric narrow alley of yakitori stalls near Shinjuku Station. The smoke and lanterns are incredibly photogenic.
activities.tips: Sit at the counter and just point at what looks good.

activities.title: Golden Gai Bar Hopping
activities.description: 200+ tiny bars packed into 6 narrow alleys. Each bar has a unique theme. Check for cover charges before entering.

activities.title: Tsukiji Outer Market Breakfast
activities.description: The old fish market's outer market is still thriving. Try tamagoyaki (egg omelette), fresh sashimi, and grilled seafood skewers.
activities.tips: Get there before 9am for the freshest options.

activities.title: Senso-ji Temple & Nakamise-dori
activities.description: Tokyo's oldest temple. Walk through the iconic Kaminarimon (Thunder Gate) and the shopping street leading to the temple.
activities.tips: Draw an omikuji (fortune slip) — if you get bad luck, tie it to the rack!

activities.title: Hoppy Street Lunch
activities.description: Retro drinking street near Senso-ji. Great for daytime drinking and street food vibes.

activities.title: Tokyo Skytree
activities.description: 634m tall — Japan's tallest structure. The observation deck offers a stunning 360° view of the city.

activities.title: Akihabara Electric Town
activities.description: Anime, manga, retro games, electronics. Visit the multi-floor arcades and check out the gashapon (capsule toy) shops.
activities.tips: Super Potato for retro games, Mandarake for rare manga and figures.

activities.title: Ginza Stroll
activities.description: Tokyo's upscale shopping district. Beautiful architecture, department stores, and art galleries.

activities.title: Sushi Dinner at Sushi Dai
activities.description: Omakase sushi at the new Toyosu Market location. Worth the wait for some of the freshest sushi in Tokyo.
activities.tips: Go on a weekday to minimize wait time.

activities.title: Coffee at Onibus Coffee
activities.description: Specialty coffee in a converted house. Beautiful minimalist space with great pour-overs.

activities.title: Shimokitazawa Vintage Shopping
activities.description: Tokyo's indie/bohemian neighborhood. Incredible vintage and thrift shops, independent cafes, and live music venues.
activities.tips: Check out Stick Out and Flamingo for the best vintage finds.

activities.title: Lunch at Shirube (Curry)
activities.description: Shimokita is known for curry. Shirube does an incredible spice curry with multiple toppings.

activities.title: Daikanyama T-Site (Tsutaya Books)
activities.description: Beautifully designed bookstore/lifestyle complex. One of the most photographed spots in Tokyo for design lovers.
activities.tips: The travel book section is incredible — great for planning your next trip.

activities.title: Last-minute Shopping & Snacks
activities.description: Pick up souvenirs at Don Quijote (Shibuya Mega) or Tokyo Station's character street for unique Japanese snacks and gifts.
activities.tips: Tokyo Banana and KitKat flavors make great souvenirs.

activities.title: Head to Narita Airport
activities.description: Take the Narita Express back from Shibuya. Give yourself 3 hours before your flight.

activities.title: Flight Departure
activities.description: Sayonara Tokyo! Until next time.
activities.tips: Tax-free shopping at the airport for any last-minute picks.
